answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!With a history of diabetes it is possible that you have peripheral neuropathies. This can cause numbness. It can also be due to Vit B12 deficiency. Please consult your doctor regarding this. If the diabetes is not under control, bringing it under control will take care of the neuropathy. Please consult your diabetes specialist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am 70 years of age, a diabetic for over thr last 7 years. Occasionally, I feel numbness in my fore arms and fore feet.  This numbness is just for a few seconds. Immediately after I  massage the affected part, there is normalcy restored. What is the cause for this and what remedy you suggest?
title: Numbness in the fore arms
